A Proper Claret
Red Blend

paragraphs.text: Randall has been a pioneer and innovator in the wine space, with a relentless curiosity and desire to discover/create truly original wines in the New World. He eschews vinous special effects, and appreciates wines that speak softly but brightly.

Bonny Doon Vineyard was founded in 1983 by Randall Graham, and soon established itself as a leader in the development of Rh√¥ne varieties in California. The winery prides itself in delivering thoughtful, original wines that are fairly priced.

items: Bonny Doon Vineyard is, as we all know or should know, a strictly cabernet-free zone, at least it has been for the last twenty-nine years.
Randall Grahm, owner and winemaker, has expressed indifference, occasionally bordering on amused disdain, for this popular grape variety.

We are not really at liberty to say how Bonny Doon Vineyard has come to be entrusted with the distribution of a wine made from such improbably alien grape varieties, but suffice to say that the deal was doon grudgingly and harumphingly.

paragraphs.text: So, with these caveats, the sentiment at Bonny Doon Vineyard is that if we ever were to drink a cabernet-based blend, this would be one that would serve quite well. It is lean, neither overly alcoholic (weighing in at 13.2%) nor overly extracted, nor overly oaked; it is precisely what one would imagine A Proper Claret to be.
Proper (British) mutton, proper leg of lamb, (ideally served with proper Yorkshire pudding).
